content.description: Unknown route between color of night and flood. Well bolted, brand new hardware. I felt it was either sustained 5.7 or 5.8- Anyone with more info please post it. Route wasnt in the issue of the guide book I have either
content.protection: Bolts. 10 or so, very chill lead
content.location: Between color of night and flood

content.description: Thin start which eases to some good slab climbing.  The route trends just slightly left with 7 bolts and shares a two bolt anchor with Fabulously Fresno.  Can be rap'd/TR'd with a single 60m rope with a few feet to spare.
content.protection: 7 draws for bolts and gear for 2 bolt rap/belay station.
content.location: Basically the same start as Fabulously Fresno about 10-15 ft left of Seven Bolts.

content.description:
Crux is finessing to the first bolt on thin friction moves.

On some topos this route is misnamed "Anubis (5.9)".
content.location: Leftmost bolted route on the Hippo Wall.  Two metolius rap hangers at the top (rounded, so you can thread the rope through and rappel off).  Two ropes or a single 70m should do it.

content.description: Farthest right sport route on the Hippo wall.  As the name implies there is 7 bolts leading to a 2 bolt anchor and the route is very well protected.  Thin cruxy start gives way to easier climbing with the route trending right toward the left end of a small roof.
content.protection: 7 quickdraws and gear for two bolt anchor.
content.location: Right most bolted line on the wall, just left of the small roof.

climbs.name: Howdy Doody Time
climbs.fa: Cam & Kathy Donnahoo, Barry Chambers, John Barbella, Leni Reeves

content.description:
A slab climb, yes. But the second pitch is varied with different friction features and interesting options as one travels up a mineral stained groove.

I can only guess this route does not see a lot of traffic. There were many decomposing edges and mungey friction until the 4th bolt on the 2nd pitch. Although the most recent guide book has this at .9+, I would venture to say due to grittiness around the lower crux, its at least .10a or more between the 3rd and 4th bolt. Another crux is presented above around the 8th bolt. However, this one has a lot of good features to work with and the rock is much cleaner high up on the slab.
content.protection: The first pitch is short and not too much gear is required. The second pitch is almost 60M with 10 bolts.
content.location: The large orange mineral stained looking slab above to the left of the Hippo Wall is the "Frantic Manic Area". Although the start of the route in down in the gully to the left of Taking a Bath With Strangers (Labeled Anubis on some topos) on the Hippo Wall. An optional start that will pass the mungey crux is to join in the route at the 4th bolt on the Frantic Manic Ledge (Left of Mineral Magic).

content.description:
Slightly longer bolted line in the middle of the Hippo wall.  Very well protected as with most of the climbs on this wall.  Thin start up past the first bolt then sustained climbing up edges and incuts for the majority of the route.  Generally trending just slightly right easing toward the top.  Shares anchor with Flood (5.8)

You can technically rap from this anchor diagnally down and right to the elevated platform at the base of Trauma dogs/Fresno with a few inches to spare on a 60m rope.  But you would be unable to top-rope this route on a 60 unless you were to extend the anchor way down.
content.protection: Bolts (think 7 or 8, can't remember for sure), bolted belay/rap station.
content.location: 15 feet down and left of Trauma Dogs.

content.description: Shared start with Hippo in a bathtub. Splits after the third bolt and goes straight up instead of right and ends at the same anchor. More features than Hippo, and I thought it was easier even though the guide rates it harder. Both are worth doing!
content.location: By the bush in the middle, 4th route from the left and 5th from the right

content.description: Thin cruxy start leads to easier climbing past the second bolt.  Lots of little edges and incuts.  Shares the same start with Trauma Dogs then breaks out to the right and eventually back slightly left to meet up with Trauma Dogs at a two bolt anchor.  Very well protected route with 7 bolts.  Can be TR'd/rap'd with a 60m rope with maybe 6 feet or so to spare.
content.protection: 7 draws for bolts and whatever gear for 2 bolt rap/belay station.

content.description:
Follow an obvious black streak up the wall. Somewhat sustained slab climbing through the first few bolts before the difficulty eases up high.

I rappelled the route with 2 ropes. I am not sure if a single 70 will make it, be sure to ties knots in your rope before trying!
content.location: 3rd bolted route from the left up a black water streak.
